basics.name: Sirui Tao
basics.label: Researcher and Engineer
basics.summary: A master's student in Computer Science and Engineering at UCSD, focusing on HCI and Graphics, with a background in data science and statistics, passionate about combining AI with design and technology.

work.name: UCSD, Protolab
work.summary: Investigating generative models for contextual multimodal documents to aid designers and support collaborative scenarios.

work.name: UCSD, Tzu-Mao Li’s Lab
work.summary: Combining neural methods and traditional graphics pipelines to enable flexible and fast-forward physical interaction prediction; studying inverse physical prediction using diffusion-based models.

work.name: UCSD
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Introduction to Artificial Intelligence; held office hours and graded assignments.

work.name: UCSD
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Design of Everyday Things during Spring quarter; supported students in understanding design principles.

work.name: UCSD
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Design of Everyday Things during Fall quarter; supported students in understanding design principles.

work.name: UCSD
work.summary: Assisted in teaching Introduction to Data Science; guided students through data science projects.

work.name: SchedGo
work.summary: Built data infrastructure and conducted analytics; developed marketing data analytics to identify key user groups; designed a survey model for front-end user feedback.

work.name: UCSD, HDSI
work.summary: Developed GraphHSCN, a novel graph neural network architecture for long-range interaction modeling.

work.name: Tesla
work.summary: Developed lossless image compression solutions and advanced statistical process control tools.

work.name: UCSD, CogTools Lab
work.summary: Contributed to Physion and Physion++, focusing on data analysis and designing 3D stimuli for non-rigid physical interactions.

work.name: Bühler Group
work.summary: Initiated MLOps image-labeling features for defect detection and prototyped cross-functional innovation tools.

work.name: J.D. Power
work.summary: Optimized workflow for quality analytics by automating data processing and report pipelines.

work.name: Bosch
work.summary: Developed Tableau dashboards for manufacturing analytics; reduced bottleneck diagnosing time by 80%.

education.summary: M.S. in Computer Science and Engineering - HCI & Graphics, advised by Prof. Steven Dow and Prof. Tzu-Mao Li.
B.S. degrees with a minor in Economics, advised by Prof. Judith Fan.

awards.title: IGE Shah Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded for research contributions in generative AI and data science.

awards.title: TRELS Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Recognized for academic excellence and research innovation.

awards.title: TRELS Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Recognized for academic excellence and research innovation.

awards.title: Data Science Student Representative
awards.summary: Elected as student representative for the Data Science program at HDSI.

awards.title: HDSI Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding research in data science.

awards.title: HDSI Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding research in data science.

awards.title: Provost Honor
awards.summary: Consistently recognized for academic excellence throughout undergraduate studies.

publications.name: HotSpot: Screened Poisson Equation for Signed Distance Function Optimization
publications.publisher: In submission to Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition 2025
publications.summary: A study on optimizing signed distance functions with screened Poisson equations.

publications.name: DesignWeaver: Dimensional Scaffolding for Text-to-Image Product Design
publications.publisher: In submission to Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems 2025
publications.summary: Explores dimensional scaffolding to enhance designer workflows in generative AI.

publications.name: Physion++: Evaluating Physical Scene Understanding with Objects Consisting of Different Physical Attributes in Humans and Machines
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society
publications.summary: Evaluates physical scene understanding in humans and machines with varying physical attributes.

publications.name: Physion: Evaluating Physical Prediction from Vision in Humans and Machines
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems
publications.summary: A study on evaluating physical prediction from vision in humans and machines.

references.name: Professor Steven Dow
references.reference: Master Advisor for my research in HCI.

references.name: Professor Tzu-Mao Li
references.reference: Master Advisor for my research in Graphics.

references.name: Professor Judith Fan
references.reference: Undergraduate advisor for my research in Intuitive Physics.

projects.name: Tree-of-thoughts Context-aware Encoding for LLMs
projects.summary: Developed a context-aware encoding algorithm for LLMs to improve retrieval and contextual understanding.

projects.name: GraphHSCN
projects.summary: Developed a novel graph neural network architecture for long-range interaction modeling.
